history.content:
I took both 186 and 168 last Fall and I might therefore be helpful in answering your question. Personally, I felt the concepts I learnt in 186 were more useful in terms of recruiting and interviewing as databases form an integral part of close to every company, and moreover, concepts in 186 such as parallelism and concurrency are helpful in giving intro knowledge in CS systems (which seems to show up on job interviews a lot, and you won't be able to attempt those unless you've taken 162 or so).

Further, I felt that the projects in 186 involved significant coding maturity and ends up helping you to really master Java (really helped me again in prepping for interviews), while the projects in 168 are comparatively less challenging.

Summing up, if you are looking to work in a networks company soon, 168 is the obvious choice to go with. But if you are looking for a more general experience applying to a broad range of companies in the industry, go with 186. Also, I'd strongly advise you to take both these classes by the time you graduate in case you are looking to go into industry as a software engineer.

children.subject: Depends on what you are trying to prioritize, but most of the recruiting happens in the Fall and it would probably help if you do 186 at that time maybe? I know this is what helped me so I am just sharing that. Although I understand that 168 is only offered in the Fall and therefore, in case you're a rising senior, you wouldn't get another chance for 168.

You mentioned that the parallelism/concurrency concepts of 186 were important for interviews, so if I'm taking 162 in the fall should I be good on that front (allowing me to push 186 to the spring)? (i'll be a senior in the fall)

Everyone says that the majority of recruiting happens in the fall, but I don't think that is true at all. I've gotten a non-stop flow of interviews in February and March ranging from start ups to mid-size to big4 and got 0 interviews in the fall.  This was for internships though so maybe it's different for full-time.
Hmm, in that case, do you think Fall: 162 + 168 and Spring: 186 + 189 is a good combo?

history.content:
If I had to choose one between 168 and 186, which one is better for someone going into general software engineering? 

Also, is 186 and 189 doable (i'll also be taking lower-div physics with this combo)?
history.subject: CS 168 vs 186
